properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 9 at 1:39PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...PROLONGED PERIOD OF MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL EXPECTED MONDAY
THROUGH TUESDAY...

.A frontal boundary is expected to stall across the northern
portions of Central Alabama Monday, leading to periods of moderate
to heavy rainfall through Tuesday. Widespread rainfall of three
to six inches is possible along and north of Interstate 20, with
two to three inches south of Interstate 20. This will lead to the
potential for flooding of streams and low lying areas. Localized
flash flooding cannot be ruled out, especially in urban and poor
drainage areas.

The National Weather Service in Birmingham has expanded the

* Flood Watch to include a portion of east central Alabama,
including the following areas, Clay and Randolph.

* From Monday morning through Tuesday afternoon.

* Forecast rainfall of two to three inches, with locally higher
amounts possible.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
